de.upb.t2t.control.database

Class AbstractSQLiteBridge

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.upb.t2t.control.database.AbstractSQLiteBridge
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SQLiteBridgeDesktop

    public abstract class AbstractSQLiteBridge
extends java.lang.Object

    This is the central class for communication with the local SQL database. It is not (!) responsible for communicating with the online database and thus potential damage done to the local db file will be overwritten on the next update anyway. It offers functions to make queries and modify TranscriptionItems. The actual implementation of this class is dependent on the underlying OS, as e.g. Android has its own library for SQLite. Note that the bridge employs a singleton pattern and therefore its instance can be obtained by calling getInstance() from anywhere inside the application. The instance itself will be initialised by the AbstractSQLiteBridge.SQLiteBridgeFactory.

    Developer Note: For developer convenience, there are a few static Strings stored inside this class. They are flagged as deprecated and should only be used for debugging. With their help, the SQLite database may be re-initialised and some of the tables filled with default values.

    Author:
    Michel May (michel-may@gmx.de)
    See Also:
    queryDatabase(String), addTranscription(String, WordClass, Variety, TranscriptionType, String), DatabaseEntry, TranscriptionItem, AbstractSQLiteBridge.SQLiteBridgeFactory

      • queryDatabase

        public abstract DatabaseEntry queryDatabase(java.lang.String lemma)
                                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Queries the SQLite file for the given lemma and converts any information into a DatabaseEntry object. In the event that no entry inside the database matches the query, the returned database entry will be empty, but not null.
        Parameters:
        lemma - the lemma to look up
        Returns:
        the corresponding DatabaseEntry object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

        Queries the local database for the transcription item whose ID matches the given one.
        Parameters:
        transID - the transcription item's ID.
        Returns:
        the corresponding TranscriptionItem object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • addTranscription

        public abstract TranscriptionItem addTranscription(java.lang.String lemma,
                                                   WordClass wordClass,
                                                   Variety variety,
                                                   TranscriptionType transType,
                                                   java.lang.String transcription)
                                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Adds a transcription item to the local database.
        Parameters:
        lemma - the transcription item's corresponding lemma.
        wordClass - the transcription item's corresponding word class.
        variety - the transcription item's corresponding variety.
        transType - the transcription item's corresponding type.
        transcription - the phonetic transcription String.
        Returns:
        the TranscriptionItem object as retrieved from the database after adding the given data.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

        Updates an existing transcription item inside the local database.

        wordClass - the transcription item's new word class.
        variety - the transcription item's new variety.
        transType - the transcription item's new type.
        transcription - the transcription item's new phonetic String.
        Returns:
        the updated TranscriptionItem object as retrieved from the database after adding the given data.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • deleteLemma

        protected abstract void deleteLemma(int lemmaID)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        Deletes a lemma from the local database. Since deleting a lemma from the lemmas table without clearing its corresponding transcription items may potentially damage the structure of the database (or at least lead to dead entries), this function is protected.
        Parameters:
        lemmaID - the lemma's ID
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • deleteLemma

        protected abstract void deleteLemma(java.lang.String lemma)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        Deletes a lemma from the local database. Since deleting a lemma from the lemmas table without clearing its corresponding transcription items may potentially damage the structure of the database (or at least lead to dead entries), this function is protected.
        Parameters:
        lemma - the lemma
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getVarieties

        public abstract Variety[] getVarieties()
                                throws java.lang.Exception
        Queries the database for information on the varieties it contains and converts said info into an array of Variety objects. This function should be called, when the Variety class is being loaded for the first time.
        Returns:
        an array of all Variety objects that could be found in the database.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

        Returns:

      • getLemmaID

        protected abstract int getLemmaID(java.lang.String lemma)
                           throws java.lang.Exception
        A convenience function to obtain the given lemma's internal ID from the local database. As no other part of the application needs to know about that number and it is only of importance for implementations of the AbstractSQLiteBridge, this function is marked as protected.
        Parameters:
        lemma - the lemma whose ID to fetch.
        Returns:
        the lemma's corresponding ID.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
